comments.body: I think this is something that @a14n recently fixed.  Plan is to get a plugin availalbe to the analyzer to check this.  But for now I suspect we shouldn't re-introduce the extra space.
It's not broken, actually.  That's how dartfmt formats it, and Ian has explicitly said that the extra spaces are fine.
Ahh I see - sorry, this isn't one of the cases that his changes impacted.  sorry about that

See https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/25251#pullrequestreview-184323664

I'm not aware of the final decision about that and I'm interested because at some point I will add a rule to check this style.
I don't think it counts as a "final decision", but Ian expressed "not having a strong opinion about this" a while ago: https://github.com/dart-lang/dart_style/issues/658#issuecomment-371346116

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +199,203 @@    this.platform = const LocalPlatform(),
    HttpReader httpReader,
  })  : assert(revision.length == 40),
        flutterRoot = Directory(path.join(tempDir.path, 'flutter')),
        httpReader = httpReader ?? http.readBytes,

comments.body:
Please add a comment pointing to docs for the attrib command.

Separately, is there anything that could cause the attrib command not to be present?

Added link.

It ships with Windows. The only reason it wouldn't be available is if you've hosed your Windows setup.
